title: Like It Or Not, Facebook's 'Like' Gets Emotive
text:
Facebook's 'like' button is getting a makeover to allow users to be more emotive in their responses. No longer will people be confined to 'liking' their friend's Facebook status, but they will also be able to respond with: 'love', 'haha', 'yay', 'wow', 'sad' and 'angry'.
"We studied which comments and reactions are most commonly and universally expressed across Facebook, then worked to design an experience around them that was elegant and fun," the company's chief product officer Chris Cox said.
"As you can see, it’s not a 'dislike' button, though we hope it addresses the spirit of this request more broadly."
Many users have been wanting Facebook to introduce a 'dislike' button, so they can respond more appropriately to negative news on the social media site.
Play video "Sept: Facebook On 'Dislike' Idea" Video: Sept: Facebook On 'Dislike' Idea At this stage, the new "expressive" button will be available in Ireland and Spain as part of a pilot test.
"We’ll use the feedback from this to improve the feature and hope to roll it out to everyone soon," Mr Cox said.
Within hours of making the announcement on Facebook, Mr Cox's post had been 'liked' by thousands of users.
